Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RP9 (natural AMPs; Crocodile, reptiles, animals; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE most resembles (41.7% similarity)Holothuroidin 1.Activity: Active against Gram-negative V. cholerae and Gram-positive B. pumilus (MIC 61.2 uM).Toxicity: At the MIC, it caused 3.3% hemolysis of human red blood cells (hRBCs). Weak anticancer activity (IC50s are 126 uM to HeLa cells and 168 uM to CaSki cells). Doesn't appear to be toxic. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Theansungnoen T, Maijaroen S, Jangpromma N, Yaraksa N1, Daduang S, Temsiripong T, Daduang J, Klaynongsruang S. 2016
Literature Information.Title: Cationic Antimicrobial Peptides Derived from Crocodylus siamensis Leukocyte Extract, Revealing Anticancer Activity and Apoptotic Induction on Human Cervical Cancer Cells
